FuncDef:
The snmp-agent command enables the SNMP agent function for APs.
The undo snmp-agent command disables the SNMP agent function for APs.
By default, the SNMP agent function is disabled for APs.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An SNMP agent is a process that runs on a managed device. It maintains data of the managed device, responds to requests from an NMS, and sends management data to the NMS. Before configuring SNMP, you must run the snmp-agent command to enable the SNMP agent function. In port extension scenarios, you can run snmp-agent command in virtual access port extension view to enables the SNMP agent function for APs.
The snmp-agent command opens SNMP port 161 for both IPv4 and IPv6 if the port is not opened.
Configuration Impact
Running the undo snmp-agent command invalidates the settings of all SNMP versions (SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c) for APs.
Running the undo snmp-agent command causes the configurations of all SNMP versions (SNMPv1, SNMPv2c, and SNMPv3) on the device to become invalid.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
